hypothesis_content.title: L2 Breakout Retest Pattern After News Spike
hypothesis_content.statement: When an L2 token (ARB/STRK/MATIC) experiences a >15% price spike on high volume following positive news, then retraces 38.2-50% of that move over 2-3 days while maintaining above key support (previous resistance turned support), it will resume upward momentum to retest the spike high within 5-7 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News-driven spikes often overheat short-term. Healthy retracement to Fibonacci levels with support hold indicates strong underlying demand. Recent L2 news (STRK, ARB analysis) provides multiple test cases. Breakout retests have high historical success in crypto.
entry_conditions: Token had >15% single-day move on volume >200% of 30-day average (news-driven)
Token retraced 38.2-50% of that move over 2-3 days
Price holds above previous resistance level (now support) on daily close
4-hour RSI between 40-50 (cooling off but not oversold)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Retest of news spike high (previous local high)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Daily close below identified support level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price breaks below support level with volume, or fails to show upward momentum within 3 days of entry (remains in tight consolidation below 50% retracement).
